metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16827 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
The aout_get_external_symbols function in aoutx.h in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29.1, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (slurp_symtab invalid free and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted ELF file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-16827` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-common - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-for-build - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-for-host - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-i686-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-i686-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-i686-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-ia64-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-m68k-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-multiarch - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-riscv64-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-sh4-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-source - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-sparc64-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-x86-64-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnux32 - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
libbinutils - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
libctf-nobfd0 - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
libctf0 - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: binutils package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04').
